intro: Phanerophlebia macroptera, commonly known as the large-leaf phanerophlebia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, elliptical leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
